item.title: Open Access Opt-out
item.content:encoded:
About you I am ... [radio faculty use_label_element free_text "a member of the faculty|Professor" "a non-faculty author|Non-faculty" "submitting this form on behalf of an author (please enter the author's name below)|Proxy for "]
About the article

Co-authors

You acknowledge that the MIT co-authors whose email addresses you supply below would also like waivers for this publication. (Authors included below will receive a copy of the waiver.)

Please separate names with commas Please separate email addresses with commas Reason you are opting out: [radio why use_label_element free_text "Publisher requirement" "Other (please specify):"]
[submit "Send"] 1 Open access policy opt-out form MIT Libraries oapolicyoptout@mit.edu From: [fullname] <[email]> Subject: Open access policy opt-out form Message Body: This MIT open access opt-out form was signed on: [_time] on [_date]. Hello [fullname], [coauthorname] Thank you for this notice, accepted on behalf of the MIT Libraries' Director's Office, which is the Provost's designate for waivers of the MIT faculty open access policy and the authors' opt-in open access license. As noted in the faculty policy: "The Provost or Provost's designate will waive application of the policy for a particular article upon written notification by the author, who informs MIT of the reason." The policy is therefore waived for this article by receipt of your message below. item.title: OA publishing fund request
item.content:encoded:
Form to request support from the Open Access Article Publication Subvention Fund (OAAPSF)

This form should be used by MIT affiliates to request funding for open access publication fees from eligible journals. The request will be reviewed for eligibility and the author informed whether it has been approved. If the request is approved, the author will need to forward proof of payment for the publication charges to oafund@mit.edu. Payment will be reimbursed to an MIT account.

Eligibility Requirements Please check here to indicate you have reviewed the eligibility requirements and believe you and your article are eligible. Please note that articles supported by grant funds from sponsors who allow authors to use grant funds for publication fees are not eligible for reimbursement through the OAAPSF. [checkbox* eligibility use_label_element "Yes, I've reviewed the eligibility requirements (required)"]
Author information [group other-dlc-group] [/group]
Article information
Please submit this form for review and approval and then, when available, send the associated publisher's invoice to: oafund@mit.edu. [submit "Send"] 1 MIT Libraries OA publishing fund request MIT Libraries oafund@mit.edu Eligibility requirements: [eligibility] Author info: [author-fullname] [author-email] [author-address] [department] [other-dlc] Article info: Title: [article-title] Journal: [article-journal] Sponsor: [article-sponsor] Amount charged for publication: [article-amountcharged] Amount requested: [article-amountrequested] -- This e-mail was sent from a contact form on MIT Libraries (http://libraries.mit.edu) Reply-To: [author-email] 1 MIT Libraries "[your-subject]" MIT Libraries [your-email] Message Body: [your-message] -- This e-mail was sent from a contact form on MIT Libraries (http://libraries.mit.edu) Reply-To: web-lib@mit.edu Thank you for your request. If the request is approved, you will need to forward proof of payment for the publication charges to oafund@mit.edu. Payment will be reimbursed to an MIT account. item.title: MIT authors' opt-in open access license
item.content:encoded:
Sign the MIT authors' opt-in open access license

Authors at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology are committed to disseminating the fruits of their research and scholarship as widely as possible. In keeping with that commitment, by signing this license, I hereby grant to the Massachusetts Institute of Technology nonexclusive permission to make available my scholarly articles and to exercise the copyright in those articles for the purpose of open dissemination. In legal terms, I grant to MIT a nonexclusive, irrevocable, paid-up, worldwide license to exercise any and all rights under copyright relating to each of my scholarly articles, in any medium, provided that the articles are not sold for a profit, and to authorize others to do the same. This license will apply to all scholarly articles written while I am employed by, have an Academic Instructional Staff or Academic Research Staff (e.g., Postdoctoral Fellow) appointment from, or am registered as a student at MIT, except for any articles completed before the execution of this license and any articles for which I entered into an incompatible licensing or assignment agreement before the execution of this license. This license will not cover any article for which I notify MIT in writing that I am opting out of the license for that particular article. To assist the Institute in distributing the scholarly articles, as of the date of publication, I will make available an electronic copy of my final version of the article at no charge to a designated representative of the Provost's Office in appropriate formats (such as PDF) specified by the Provost's Office. I understand that the Provost's Office will make the scholarly article available to the public in an open-access repository.

[checkbox* checkbox-739 default:1 use_label_element "Yes, I grant this nonexclusive permission to MIT."]

item.title: Library Storage Annex request
item.dc:creator: feiden
item.content:encoded:
<fieldset><legend>Personal information</legend> <label> Your first name [text your-first-name] </label>
<label> Your last name* [text* your-last-name] </label>
<label> Your email* [email* your-email] </label>
<label> Your MIT ID number (required for MIT community) [text your-id] </label>
<label> Your MIT status* [select* mit-status include_blank "MIT undergrad student" "MIT grad student" "MIT faculty" "MIT research staff" "MIT staff" "MIT other" "non-MIT"]</label>
<label> Your phone number [tel phonenumber]</label>
</fieldset>
<fieldset><legend>Your request</legend>
<label> Where would you like to pick up these materials?* [select* pickup-library include_blank "Barker" "Dewey" "Hayden" "Lewis Music" "Rotch" "Library Storage Annex"]</label>
<label> Book or journal title* [text* book-journal] </label>
<label> Author [text writer] </label>
<fieldset><legend>Citation</legend>
<label> Call number* (if item has no call number, fill in "n/a") [text* call-number] </label>
<label> Volume* [text* volume] </label>
<label> Issue* [text* issue] </label>
<label> Date* [text* date] </label>
<label> Pages [text pages] </label> </fieldset>
<label>Is there other information we may need to respond to your request? [textarea other-info] </label>
</fieldset>
[recaptcha]
[submit "Send"] 1 [pickup-library], [your-last-name], [book-journal] MIT Libraries <noreply@libraries.mit.edu> annexreq@mit.edu ----PLEASE DO NOT REPLY TO THIS EMAIL. THANKS!----
Thank you for your request. Most items are delivered within 1-2 business days. You can call the pick-up library to find out whether your item has arrived: https://libraries.mit.edu/locations/.
If you made an error or have a question, please call the Annex at 617-253-7040.

Other information: [other-info]

1

item.title: Suggest a purchase
item.dc:creator: darcy
item.content:encoded:
<fieldset> <legend> Your information</legend> <label> Name (required) [text* fullname] </label> <label> MIT Kerberos email (required) [email* email] </label>
<label>Status (required) [select* status include_blank "MIT Undergrad Student" "MIT Grad Student" "MIT Faculty" "MIT Research Staff" "MIT Staff" "MIT Other"]</label>
<label> Department, lab, center (required) [select_dlc* department] </label> [group other-dlc-group] <label> Please enter the name of your department, lab, or center [text other-dlc]</label> [/group]
</fieldset>
<fieldset> <legend>Suggested purchase</legend> <label> Title (required) [text* item-title default:get] </label> <label> Author (required) [text* item-author default:get] </label>
What format do you prefer? (required) [radio electronic use_label_element "Electronic (online access)" "Print/other tangible format (e.g., CD, DVD)"]
Is another format acceptable? (required) [radio alternate use_label_element "Yes, alternate format is acceptable" "No, only the requested format is acceptable"]
Priority (required)
[radio priority use_label_element"Urgent (1-2 weeks)|1" "Soon (2-4 weeks)|2" "Anytime would be fine|3" ]
<label> Publisher [text publisher default:get] </label> <label> Edition [text edition default:get] </label> <label> Publication date [text date default:get] </label> <label> ISBN/ISSN [text isbn default:get] </label> <label> URL [text url default:get] </label>
<label>Additional information Please provide any details that may help us fulfill your request (including whether you already submitted a request to another MIT Libraries service - e.g., ILB/ILLiad, Borrow Direct). [textarea otherinfo] </label>
</fieldset>
[submit "Send"] 1 Suggested purchase: [priority] - [item-title] MIT Libraries <noreply@libraries.mit.edu> suggestedpurchase@mit.edu Thank you for your suggestion! If you requested...
- An e-book: If we are able to purchase the e-book, we will notify you when it is accessible through the Libraries’ catalog. You will not hear from us until then, unless there is a problem with placing the order.
- A tangible item (e.g. book, DVD): If successfully purchased, the item will be put on hold for you at the library pick-up location indicated below.
- A subscription to a journal or database: We are not always able to acquire databases and journal subscriptions due to cost and other restrictions; a librarian will follow up with you via email with additional information about your request.
---------------------------------------------------
PERSONAL INFO
Name: [fullname] MIT Kerberos email: [email] Department: [department] Other/lab/center: [other-dlc] Status: [status]
CITATION
Author: [item-author] Title: [item-title]
Preferred format (electronic or print): [electronic] Alternate format permissible: [alternate] Priority: [priority] Priority key: 1: Urgent (1-2 weeks); 2: Soon (2-4 weeks); 3: Anytime
Publisher: [publisher] Edition: [edition] Publication date: [date] ISBN/ISSN: [isbn] URL: [url] Additional information: [otherinfo] Reply-To: [email]
MIT Libraries "[your-subject]" MIT Libraries <wordpress@libraries.mit.edu> [your-email] Message Body: [your-message]
-- This e-mail was sent from a contact form on MIT Libraries (http://libraries.mit.edu) Reply-To: web-lib@mit.edu
Your suggested purchase has been submitted. Thank you! There was an error trying to send your suggestion. Please try again later. One or more fields have an error. Please check and try again. What format do you prefer? (required) [radio electronic use_label_element "Electronic (online access)" "Print/other tangible format (e.g., CD, DVD)"]
Is another format acceptable? (required) [radio alternate use_label_element "Yes, alternate format is acceptable" "No, only the requested format is acceptable"]
Priority (required)
[radio priority use_label_element"Urgent (1-2 weeks)|1" "Soon (2-4 weeks)|2" "Anytime would be fine|3" ]
<label> Publisher [text publisher default:get] </label> <label> Edition [text edition default:get] </label> <label> Publication date [text date default:get] </label> <label> ISBN/ISSN [text isbn default:get] </label> <label> URL [text url default:get] </label>
<label>Additional information Please provide any details that may help us fulfill your request (including whether you already submitted a request to another MIT Libraries service - e.g., ILB/ILLiad, Borrow Direct). [textarea otherinfo] </label>
</fieldset>
[submit "Send"]

a:9:{s:6:"active";b:1;s:7:"subject";s:45:"Suggested purchase: [priority] - [item-title]";s:6:"sender";s:41:"MIT Libraries <noreply@libraries.mit.edu>";s:9:"recipient";s:25:"suggestedpurchase@mit.edu";s:4:"body";s:1222:"Thank you for your suggestion! If you requested...
- An e-book: If we are able to purchase the e-book, we will notify you when it is accessible through the Libraries’ catalog. You will not hear from us until then, unless there is a problem with placing the order.
- A tangible item (e.g. book, DVD): If successfully purchased, the item will be put on hold for you at the library pick-up location indicated below.
- A subscription to a journal or database: We are not always able to acquire databases and journal subscriptions due to cost and other restrictions; a librarian will follow up with you via email with additional information about your request.
---------------------------------------------------

item.title: Share your open access story
item.content:encoded:
MIT authors have made their articles openly available to all readers. Please share how this access affects or benefits you.
<label>Tell us your story: (required) [textarea* oa-story]</label>
<label>Please tell us what article you were reading (if you would like to share this information): [textarea oa-article]</label>
<label>Select your role: [select role include_blank "Faculty/researcher at a university" "Researcher at a corporation" "Student" "Other"]</label>
<label>If your role is "other," please specify: [text role-other]</label>
<label>Your country: [text country]</label>
These stories, contributed anonymously by our readers, help support open access to research worldwide. We very much appreciate being able to share what this access has meant for you.
[recaptcha]

item.dc:creator: feiden
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Reopening for spring term Jan 31
item.dc:creator: feiden
item.content:encoded: All library locations will reopen for browsing and in-person services. See spring term hours for location-specific information and MIT campus access for guidelines on visiting. If you have questions, Ask Us.

item.title: Closed for winter break Dec 24-Jan 2
item.dc:creator: feiden
item.content:encoded: See what's available during break. If a major library system is down or for other urgent issues: Ask Us.

item.title: All libraries closing at 5pm, February 23 (Monday), due to weather
item.dc:creator: darcy
item.content:encoded: 24/7 study spaces & electronic resources will be available during the closure. See more hours info.

item.title: Serform
item.content:encoded:
<fieldset name="basic"> <legend> Please enter the following basic information </legend> <label>Your name (required): [text* your-name]</label> <label>Your email (required): [email* your-email]</label> <label>Your library/department: [text your-dept]</label> <label> Entry/title (required): [text* your-title]</label> <label>Call number: [text call-num]</label> <label> Barton system number (required): [text* sys-num]</label> <label>PO number (required): [text* po-num]</label> Select the serform type: [select* serform-type first_as_label "Please select the type" "Cessation" "Cancellation" "Format change" "Title change"] </fieldset>
[group cessation] <fieldset name="cessation"> <legend> Cessation Details </legend> <label>Ceased publication with: [text ceased-pub]</label> <label>How do you know it has ceased?: [textarea ceased-reason]</label> <label>If applicable, enter the OCLC number here: [text oclc-num]</label> <label> Additional notes: [textarea ces-notes]</label> Do the library's holdings need to be updated?: [select* ces-hold "No" "Yes, discard complete holdings" "Yes, correct summary holdings"] </fieldset> [/group]
[group cancellation] <fieldset name="cancellation"> <legend> Cancellation Details </legend> <label>Cancellation effective with: [text cancel-effect]</label> <label>Additional notes: [textarea can-notes]</label> Do the library's holdings need to be updated?: [select* can-hold "No" "Yes, discard complete holdings" "Yes, correct summary holdings"] </fieldset> [/group]
[group format] <fieldset name="format"> <legend> Format Details </legend> <label>Last issue in old format: [text last-format]</label> <label>First issue in new format: [text first-format]</label> <label>Format changed to (e.g. online, CD-ROM, etc): [text* form-change]</label> <label>From (e.g. print, CD-ROM, etc): [text* from-form]</label> <label>Additional notes: [textarea form-notes]</label> Do the library's holdings need to be updated?: [select* form-hold "No" "Yes, discard complete holdings" "Yes, correct summary holdings"] </fieldset> [/group]
[group title] <fieldset name="title"> <legend> Title Details </legend> <label>Last issue with previous title: [text last-title]</label> <label>First issue with current title: [text first-title]</label> <label>Title changed to: [text new-title]</label> <label>If OCLC provides proof of this title change, please give the old OCLC number here: [text old-oclc]</label> <label>And the new OCLC number here: [text new-oclc]</label> <label>Additional notes: [textarea title-notes]</label> Do the library's holdings need to be updated?: [select* title-hold "No" "Yes, discard complete holdings" "Yes, correct summary holdings"] </fieldset> [/group]
[group correcthold] <fieldset name="correct"> <legend>Details </legend> <label>Enter the corrected holdings here: [textarea correct-hold]</label> </fieldset> [/group]
<fieldset name="uploads"> <legend> File uploads </legend> If you have any accompanying documents you wish to upload, do so here: [file your-file1] [file your-file2] [file your-file3] </fieldset>
[submit "Submit this serform now"] 1 [serform-type] Serform: [po-num] [your-title] [your-name] <serform@mit.edu> serform-lib@mit.edu Serform Entered [_date] ========================== Basic Information ------------------- From: [your-name], [your-email], [your-dept]
Call Number: [call-num]
Entry: [your-title]
Barton System Number: [sys-num]
PO: [po-num] [cessation] Cessation Details ----------------------- Ceased publication with: [ceased-pub]
How do you know it has ceased?: [ceased-reason]
Check this OCLC number for further proof: [oclc-num]
Additional notes: [ces-notes]
Do the library's holdings need to be updated?: [ces-hold] [/cessation] [cancellation] Cancellation Details -------------------- Cancelled with: [cancel-effect]
Additional notes: [can-notes]
Do the library's holdings need to be updated?: [can-hold] [/cancellation] [format] Format Change Details ------------------------ Old format: [from-form]
Last issue old format: [last-format]
New format: [form-change]
First issue new format: [first-format]
Additional notes: [form-notes]
Do the library's holdings need to be updated?: [form-hold] [/format] [title] Title Change Details ---------------------- Old title: [your-title]
Last issue old title: [last-title]
New title: [new-title]
First issue new title: [first-title]
Old OCLC number: [old-oclc]
New OCLC number: [new-oclc]
Additional notes: [title-notes]
Do the library's holdings need to be updated?: [title-hold] [/title] [correcthold] Holdings: --------------- [correct-hold] [/correcthold] Reply-To: [your-email] [your-file1] [your-file2] [your-file3]

item.title: Order form for information resources
item.content:encoded:
[radio is-rush default:2 "Yes|RUSH" "No|"] [radio your-format use_label_element "Electronic Only" "Print + Electronic" "Print Only"] [group eleconly clear_on_hide] [radio elec-type use_label_element "Database" "Data set (Numeric, Text, or GIS)" "E-Book" "E-Book Collection or backfile" "E-Journal or E-Serial" "E-Journal collection or backfile" "Major reference work"] [/group] [group printelec clear_on_hide] [radio printelect-type use_label_element "Journal/Serial" "Major reference work"] [/group] [group az-listed clear_on_hide] [radio include use_labeL_element "Yes" "No"] [group database clear_on_hide]

File Uploads [file file-01 filetypes:jpg|jpeg|png|gif|pdf|doc|docx|ppt|pptx|txt|xls|xlsx limit:5mb] [file file-02 filetypes:jpg|jpeg|png|gif|pdf|doc|docx|ppt|pptx|txt|xls|xlsx limit:5mb] [file file-03 filetypes:jpg|jpeg|png|gif|pdf|doc|docx|ppt|pptx|txt|xls|xlsx limit:5mb] [file file-04 filetypes:jpg|jpeg|png|gif|pdf|doc|docx|ppt|pptx|txt|xls|xlsx limit:5mb] *Supported file formats: jpg,jpeg,png,gif,pdf,doc,docx,ppt,pptx,txt,xls,xlsx
[submit "Submit"] 1 Order request [is-rush]: [your-title] ([your-format], [elec-type][printelect-type][printonly-type], [bib-pub]) Libraries ACE Order Form ames-orders@mit.edu Thanks for your order -- what happens next? Your order will be triaged and processed by acquisitions staff, and you will be notified of progress at key points during the process. If you have a question about your order, you may: 1. Reply back to this message and ask for an update. 2. For eresources, check StaffVera (and here's a reminder of how to do that: https://wikis.mit.edu/confluence/display/LIBERTEAM/StaffVera+via+FileMaker+Pro). 3. For tangible resources, check Barton Here are the details that were submitted: Authenticated user: [your-email] Rush: [is-rush] Format type: [your-format] Resource type: [elec-type] [printelect-type] [printonly-type] Request inclusion in A-Z Databases? [include] Preferred LG friendly URL: [get-url] A-Z subject(s): [database-subjects] A-Z description: [eresource-veradescript] Format: [eresource-veraformat] Simultaneous users: [eresource-vera-simultaneoususers] Title: [your-title] Publisher: [bib-pub] ISSN: [bib-serial] Imprint/Edition: [bib-date] Coverage details: [bib-coverage] Acquisition type: [budg-type] Price: [budg-price] Fund: [budg-fundtype] Budget/Fund Notes: [budg-notes] Host: [eresource-host] Interface/Provider/Platform: [eresource-accesstype] URL: [eresource-url] [eresource-venurl] Repository(s): [eresource-mithost] Repository Notes: [eresource-mitrepo] Delivery method: [eresource-mitdeliver] Delivery Notes: [eresource-mitnotes] Special Setup: [eresource-accessnotes] [eresource-vennotes] License details: [license-deets] [eresourceother] [/eresourceother] Product Sponsor: [eresource-sponsor] MARC records: [eresource-marc] Installation details: [eresource-verainstalls] Vendor contact info: [ven-contact] Vendor conversation: [ven-details] Unit: [catprocess-unit] Collection: [catprocess-collect] Cat/Proc instructions: [catprocess-further] Additional notes: [add-info] Cc emails: [add-email1] [add-email2] [add-email3] [add-email4] Cc: [add-email1], [add-email2], [add-email3], [add-email4] Reply-To: [your-email] [lic-file] [ven-file] [file-01] [file-02] [file-03] [file-04] 1 MIT Libraries "[your-subject]" MIT Libraries [your-email] Message Body: [your-message] -- This e-mail was sent from a contact form on MIT Libraries (http://libraries.mit.edu) Reply-To: web-lib@mit.edu Thank you for your message. It has been sent. There was an error trying to send your message. Please try again later. One or more fields have an error. Please check and try again. There was an error trying to send your message. Please try again later. You must accept the terms and conditions before sending your message. The field is required. The field is too long. The field is too short. There was an unknown error uploading the file. You are not allowed to upload files of this type. The file is too big. There was an error uploading the file. The date format is incorrect. The date is before the earliest one allowed. The date is after the latest one allowed. The number format is invalid. The number is smaller than the minimum allowed. The number is larger than the maximum allowed. The answer to the quiz is incorrect. The e-mail address entered is invalid. The URL is invalid. The telephone number is invalid. Could not verify the reCaptcha response. Please verify that you are not a robot. 0 0

item.title: LDC requests
item.dc:creator: darcy
item.content:encoded:
All fields are required unless otherwise noted.
LDC information
Personal information [group other-dlc-group] [/group]
[submit "Send"] 1 LDC corpus request: [ldc-title] MIT Libraries ldc-lib@mit.edu Thank you for your request for a pre-2016 LDC corpora. Here is a copy of your request - typical delivery time is 5-7 business days but this can vary based on corpora cost and license(s), so some may take longer. LDC catalog # or URL: [ldc-id] Title: [ldc-title] Year: [ldc-year] Cost: [cost] Intended use: [intended-use] How often will you/your colleagues use the corpus? [often-used] Potential other/future uses by you or others in the MIT research community: [other-uses] Collaborators: [collaborators] Other info: [other-info] Your information: Name: [fullname] MIT Kerberos email: [email] Department: [department] [other-dlc] Thank you - if you have any questions, please send email to: ldc-lib@mit.edu -The MIT Libraries CC: [email] Reply-To: [email] MIT Libraries "[your-subject]" MIT Libraries [your-email] Message Body: [your-message] -- This e-mail was sent from a contact form on MIT Libraries (http://libraries.mit.edu) Reply-To: web-lib@mit.edu Thank you. You will receive a response as soon as possible. There was an error trying to send your message. Please try again later. One or more fields are missing or have an error. Please check and try again. item.content:encoded: Please use this form to submit update requests, or to report errors for items in the A-Z database list. Use only the fields that need to be updated or corrected below. Additonal subject(s) to add [checkbox new-subjects "Architecture & planning" "Art & performing arts" "Business & management" "Citation software" "Engineering" "Humanities" "Interdisciplinary" "Science" "Social sciences" "Streaming media (audio, film)"] [submit "Submit"] 1 A-Z Databases: update request [changes-record] Technical services ames-orders@mit.edu Thanks for your submission -- What Happens Next? Your submission will be processed by acquisitions staff, and you will be notified when it is completed or if there are any questions.
